# Mixpeek Documentation

> Multimodal AI infrastructure that makes unstructured data searchable and AI-ready.

## Documentation Overview

Mixpeek is a multimodal data warehouse and retrieval platform. This documentation covers the complete platform for processing images, videos, audio, PDFs, and text into searchable, AI-ready assets.

## Quick Links

- Full Documentation: https://mixpeek.com/docs
- API Reference: https://mixpeek.com/docs/api-reference
- OpenAPI Spec: https://api.mixpeek.com/docs/openapi.json
- Quickstart: https://mixpeek.com/docs/overview/quickstart

## Core Concepts

### The 5-Stage Pipeline
1. **Ingestion** - Upload files via URL or direct upload to buckets
2. **Extraction** - Run AI models to extract features (embeddings, transcripts, objects)
3. **Enrichment** - Apply taxonomies and clustering for organization
4. **Indexing** - Store vectors and metadata for retrieval
5. **Retrieval** - Query with configurable retriever pipelines

### Key Resources
- **Namespaces**: Tenant isolation boundaries
- **Buckets**: Raw file storage (maps to S3/GCS)
- **Collections**: Processing pipelines with feature extractors
- **Documents**: Processed assets with embeddings and metadata
- **Retrievers**: Configurable search pipelines with stages
- **Taxonomies**: Hierarchical classification systems

## Essential Documentation Pages

### Getting Started
- /overview/introduction - Platform overview
- /overview/quickstart - 5-minute getting started guide
- /overview/concepts - Core terminology and concepts
- /overview/architecture - System architecture
- /overview/data-model - Data model and relationships

### Data Ingestion
- /ingestion/objects - Working with raw objects
- /ingestion/uploads - File upload methods
- /ingestion/buckets - Bucket management
- /ingestion/collections - Collection configuration

### Feature Extraction
- /processing/feature-extractors - Available extractors
- /processing/extractors/multimodal - Multimodal embeddings
- /processing/extractors/image - Image analysis
- /processing/extractors/text - Text processing
- /processing/extractors/document - PDF/document extraction

### Search & Retrieval
- /retrieval/retrievers - Retriever configuration
- /retrieval/stages/overview - Pipeline stages overview
- /retrieval/stages/feature-search - Vector/semantic search
- /retrieval/stages/rerank - Result reranking
- /retrieval/filters - Query filtering

### Enrichment
- /enrichment/taxonomies - Taxonomy-based classification
- /enrichment/clusters - Automatic clustering

## API Authentication

All API requests require Bearer token authentication:
```
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY
```

Namespace context is provided via header:
```
X-Namespace: ns_your_namespace_id
```

## Common API Patterns

### Create a Collection
POST /v1/collections
- Define feature extractors for processing
- Link to a bucket for source data

### Upload and Process Data
1. POST /v1/buckets/{bucket_id}/objects - Create object reference
2. POST /v1/buckets/{bucket_id}/uploads - Upload file
3. Collection triggers batch processing automatically

### Execute Search
POST /v1/retrievers/{retriever_id}/execute
- Provide query in inputs
- Configure stages for filtering, ranking, enrichment

## SDKs

- Python: `pip install mixpeek`
- JavaScript: `npm install mixpeek-sdk`
- CLI: `pip install mixpeek-cli`

## Support

- Documentation: https://mixpeek.com/docs
- GitHub: https://github.com/mixpeek
- Discord: https://discord.gg/mixpeek
- Email: support@mixpeek.com
